result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Garrette Byas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Garrette Byas in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Christopher Garrette Byas.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense request time to obtain additional discovery and a renewed offer. Case adjourned. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Garrette Byas in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Christopher Garrette Byas.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  This case was incorrectly tabbed to DV court.  This case is now reassigned to Reserve Judge, Br. 13.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CDS.sibs

Defendant Christopher Garrette Byas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Christopher Garrette Byas.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
